Package org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.reactors

Reactors are light-weight threads, or fibers, which manage and process the messages for a set of blades.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CommonReactor
    Implemented by all reactors except IsolationReactor.
    Reactor
    A reactor is a light-weight thread dedicated to processing requests and responses (requests with a response value).
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BlockingReactor
    Process requests/responses which may block the thread or tie it up with a long computation.
    IsolationReactor
    Processes each request until completion, processing responses and 1-way messages (e.g.
    NonBlockingReactor
    Process requests/responses quickly and without blocking the thread.
    ReactorBase
    Base class for reactors.
    SwingBoundReactor
    A reactor which processes requests/responses on the Swing UI thread.
    ThreadBoundReactor
    A reactor bound to a pre-existing thread.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ReactorClosedException
    This exception is thrown when passing a Request to a reactor and that reactor is closed.

Package org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.reactors Description

Reactors are light-weight threads, or fibers, which manage and process the messages for a set of blades.

Reactors are assigned a thread from the plant's thread pool when there are messages to be processed. That is except for thread-bound or swing-bound reactors wich are bound to a given thread.

Of particular note is the IsolationReactor class, which processes each request to completion before processing another request. IsolationReactors are also the parents of other reactors, so that reactors are organized into a tree.
